examples: Budget cuts are putting the squeeze on scientific research.
She squeezed the orange, releasing the refreshing pulp into her glass.
She puts the squeeze on her mother for a hundred bucks every month.
He added a squeeze of lemon to his fish tacos for a citrusy twist.
He squeezed fresh lemon juice into his water, enjoying the tangy taste of the citrus.
words.defineEn: to compress with violence, out of natural shape or condition
words.defineVi: để nén với bạo lực, ra khỏi hình dạng hoặc điều kiện tự nhiên

examples: If push comes to shove, the government will impose quotas on imports.
When push comes to shove, I have some extra savings I could tap into.
I’m tired of Dave shoving his opinions down our throats.
We were supposed to look after each other, but when push came to shove, it was every man for himself.
Shove this in there.
words.defineEn: come into rough contact with while moving
words.defineVi: tiếp xúc thô bạo với trong khi di chuyển

examples: The three year-old I babysit always spits on me when talking.
He accidentally took a bite of the inedible fruit and quickly spat it out.
That district attorney will chew you up and spit you out in the courtroom.
Both the Church report and the atheist professor are spitting into the wind, of course, because the incoming tide of superstition has a long way to rise yet.
They competed to see who could spit the cherry pits the farthest during the summer picnic.
words.defineEn: expel or eject (saliva or phlegm or sputum) from the mouth
words.defineVi: trục xuất hoặc tống ra (nước bọt hoặc đờm hoặc đờm) ra khỏi miệng

examples: I didn't sleep a wink last night.
She winked at him, playfully closing one eye.
Our newborn son is rather colicky, so my wife and I haven't slept a wink the last few nights.

In a world where miscommunication can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts, it's important to be straightforward and avoid relying on subtle or indirect cues - as they say, a nod is as good as a wink to a blind horse.
And just like give a little wink.
words.defineEn: to quickly open and close one eye as a sign of affection, or to indicate something is a secret or a joke
words.defineVi: nhanh chóng mở và nhắm một mắt như một dấu hiệu của tình cảm, hoặc để biểu thị điều gì đó là một bí mật hoặc một trò đùa

examples: Half of them, after treatment, got placebo.
It was a placebo.
A round of medicine first trains the brain, then the placebo maintains the response.
Other players wore the same device with just some placebo stimulation as a control.
The trial also doesn't have a control or placebo group.
words.defineEn: a medicine without any physiological effect that is given to a control group in an experiment to measure the effectiveness of a new drug or to patients who think they need medicine when in reality they do not
words.defineVi: một loại thuốc không có bất kỳ tác dụng sinh lý nào được dùng cho một nhóm đối chứng trong một thí nghiệm để đo lường hiệu quả của một loại thuốc mới hoặc cho những bệnh nhân nghĩ rằng họ cần thuốc trong khi thực tế họ không cần

examples: I might be getting the flu.
The flu is going around, and many people in town are as sick as horses.
My friend is afraid he might go down with the flu.
Samantha looked like a bag of bones and feathers after weeks of battling the flu.
The doctor advised me to let the flu run its course, rather than prescribing medication.
words.defineEn: influenza; an infectious disease similar to a bad cold, causing fever and severe pain
words.defineVi: cúm; một bệnh truyền nhiễm tương tự như cảm lạnh nặng, gây sốt và đau dữ dội

examples: Some people have insomnia.
I stands for insomnia.
Familial fatal insomnia usually affects adults as early as their 30s, though there have been a very small number of cases in teenagers.
This seemingly unsolvable loop is at the heart of insomnia, the world’s most common sleep disorder.
And I ended up with, like, really bad insomnia.
words.defineEn: a disorder in which one is unable to sleep or stay asleep
words.defineVi: một rối loạn trong đó một người không thể ngủ hoặc ngủ

examples: I'm always fascinated.
I am just fascinated by fluid dynamics, ballistics, optics, mechanics, aerodynamics.
In the early 1800s, he became fascinated with human digestion especially our urine.
And I'm fascinated with that stuff.
During an ocean voyage to the United States, he became fascinated with ocean invertebrates, admiring their glass-like colors and shapes.
words.defineEn: having a strong interest and curiosity in something
words.defineVi: có một sự quan tâm mạnh mẽ và sự tò mò trong một cái gì đó

examples: So, I'm very intrigued by this.
Marc: I'm very intrigued to meet Chris, because I don't know what she looks like.
And I thought, I am very intrigued and now I have to see the rest of the show.
I'm very, very intrigued about how this is gonna go down.
words.defineEn: wanting to know more about something because it seems very interesting
words.defineVi: muốn biết thêm về một cái gì đó bởi vì nó có vẻ rất thú vị

examples: For a limited time, every car in our range is available for nothing down!
When Tim arrived home after his backpacking trip, he looked like he was just skin and bones from all the hiking and limited food.

When Sarah was a college student with limited funds, she found herself less interested in shopping and spending time in commercial areas, demonstrating how a moneyless man goes fast through the market.
Their options for employment were very limited.
The evidence base is somewhat limited.
words.defineEn: not being great in extent or amount
words.defineVi: không lớn về mức độ hoặc số lượng

examples: They have a restricted host range.
number three, I just feel so restricted.
A Maine newspaper reports that the California Republican entered a restricted zone, but there is no indication he stormed the building.
Once you're on the property itself, that's the biggest time that you're more likely to have these up-charges and additional fees for restricted restaurants.
It was so restricted and heavily controlled.
words.defineEn: limited or controlled by laws or regulations
words.defineVi: bị giới hạn hoặc kiểm soát bởi luật pháp hoặc quy định

examples: I handed in my notice yesterday.
She noticed a small bird nesting on the roof of her garage.
He noticed a spider crawling up the wall.
Did you notice the way he was looking at you?
She noticed a difference in taste and texture when she switched to unbleached flour in her cookie recipe.
words.defineEn: to become aware of something or someone
words.defineVi: để trở thành nhận thức của một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Buying time may serve as a buffer against the negative effects of time stress in part by enhancing perceived control.
The idea appears to be to target perceived 'luxury' goods, while not queering the pitch for exporters.
A professional appearance can make all the difference in how others perceive your skills and abilities.
The concept of time is abstract and difficult to grasp, as it cannot be physically perceived.
She lets herself go and dances freely at the party, expressing her joy without concern for how others perceive her.
words.defineEn: to become aware or conscious of something
words.defineVi: để trở thành nhận thức hoặc ý thức về một cái gì đó

examples: You should include some examples in your essay.
We should take our cue from their example.
It's a classic example of 'full of courtesy, full of craft.'
Alec Davidson, for example, was one of those who came off worst.
Canada may follow the EU’s example by banning these products.
words.defineEn: something such as a situation, object, fact, etc. that shows or proves what one is saying
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó như một tình huống, đối tượng, thực tế, vv cho thấy hoặc chứng minh những gì một người đang nói

examples: Opposition to the war in Vietnam has set off demonstrations in several major cities.
Did you see demonstrations?
Instead, thousands of protesters confronted police in pro-democracy demonstrations.
West Virginia teachers in turn sparked similar demonstrations in Oklahoma and Arizona.
The peaceful demonstrations were in response to the decadelong rule of Serzh Sargsyan.
words.defineEn: the act of displaying or expressing something such as an emotion or opinion
words.defineVi: hành động hiển thị hoặc thể hiện một cái gì đó như một cảm xúc hoặc ý kiến

examples: The company is gaining ground rapidly with its new product launch.
He gained a reputation as a smart number-cruncher who could turn data into policy.
She gained a second wind during the campaign and turned the opinion polls around.
Smaller capitalist countries are maneuvering to gain a bigger share of the pie.
The company's marketing team is on a roll with their latest campaign, gaining a lot of attention on social media.
words.defineEn: to obtain something through one's own actions or hard work
words.defineVi: để có được một cái gì đó thông qua hành động của chính mình hoặc làm việc chăm chỉ

examples: We have access to a library with extensive resources at college.
We have access to a state-of-the-art library at the university.
A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
Students with disabilities have priority access to the lift.
The US wants access to Chinese markets.
words.defineEn: the right or opportunity to use something or benefit from it
words.defineVi: quyền hoặc cơ hội để sử dụng một cái gì đó hoặc hưởng lợi từ nó

examples: To run the hot tap.
I ran my hands under the tap.
I gently tapped the glass with a fork to make a sound.
Some bright spark left the tap running all night.
Can you hear the sound of rain tapping on the window?
words.defineEn: to make use of or access a resource or source of information
words.defineVi: để sử dụng hoặc truy cập một tài nguyên hoặc nguồn thông tin

examples: I beg your pardon.
I beg your pardon.
I beg you, from the bottom of my heart, to spare his life.
We have to go cap in hand begging for funds.
He should be on his knees begging for forgiveness.
words.defineEn: to ask humbly for something, especially when one needs or desires that thing a lot
words.defineVi: để yêu cầu một cách khiêm tốn cho một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là khi một người cần hoặc mong muốn điều đó rất nhiều

examples: We worked in harness on our last job.
Carefully, in harness with the captain, he carried Australia to victory.
After a fun weekend I was back in harness on Monday, handling paperwork at my desk.
They’ll be working in harness with other doctors to compile the report.
Morin's book is a helpful guide to surviving the first few months in harness.
words.defineEn: exploit the power of
words.defineVi: khai thác sức mạnh của

examples: So, quick as a dog can lick a dish, go snag yourself a copy!
The hungry hydra stretches out its tentacles to snag swimming prey.
In the 2000s, Rigley and other gun manufacturers hit a snag.
And I am going to snag a lot of fish.
Louboutin snagged the bottle and painted the soles of a prototype shoe.
words.defineEn: a difficulty or problem, particularly a minor, hidden, or unpredicted one
words.defineVi: một khó khăn hoặc vấn đề, đặc biệt là một vấn đề nhỏ, ẩn hoặc không được dự đoán

examples: The prices at the luxury boutique were quite high.
The weather turned quite chilly in the afternoon.
My father is quite old now
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
He plays quite well.
words.defineEn: to the highest degree
words.defineVi: ở mức độ cao nhất
